blocks.text: Imaging roadmap
Quick reference derived from Radiology Assistant and ACR guidance.
Skeletal survey essentials
Standard 2-view skull, AP/lateral C-spine, AP/lateral chest, AP pelvis, AP/lateral long bones, hands/feet.

items: High-yield: posterior ribs, classic metaphyseal lesions, scapula, spinous processes, pelvis.
Use true lateral views; minimize motion and overlap of arms over ribs.
Repeat survey improves sensitivity for healing fractures and periosteal reaction.
Consider oblique ribs in infants to increase detection of posterior fractures.

blocks.text: Neuroimaging
Dating hemorrhage, diffuse axonal injury, and venous structures.

items: CT: acute triage for subdural, skull fracture, mass effect; avoid contrast.
MRI brain: include T1/T2/FLAIR, GRE/SWI for blood products, DWI for hypoxic ischemia.
MR venography if bridging vein thrombosis is suspected.
Document retinal hemorrhage separately (ophthalmology), but note optic nerve sheath if imaged.

blocks.text: Thoracoabdominal imaging
Blunt abdominal trauma is the 2nd leading cause of mortality in abuse.

items: CT A/P w/ contrast for duodenal hematoma, pancreatic injury, adrenal hemorrhage, liver/splenic lacerations.
Look for sentinel bowel wall thickening and retroperitoneal stranding.
Ultrasound can follow stable solid-organ injuries or free fluid.
Spinal MRI if neurologic deficit or concern for epidural hematoma.

blocks.text: Red flags and pitfalls
Reporting checklist
Structured, concise communication to the care team and child protection services.

items: Patient age, clinical presentation, and who provided the history.
Imaging modalities performed (with dates) and key limitations.
Number, location, and stage of fractures; presence of rib/metaphyseal/spinal fractures.
Intracranial findings (type, location, estimated age), skull fractures (pattern, crossing sutures).
Thoracoabdominal injuries: solid-organ lacerations, bowel/mesenteric injury, adrenal or pancreatic trauma.
Recommendations: repeat skeletal survey, MRI brain/spine, ophthalmology exam, labs for bone fragility if indicated.
